name: Bernoulli number
summary: A Bernoulli number is a term in a sequence of rational numbers that appears frequently in mathematics, especially in calculus and number theory. These numbers are used in formulas for sums of integer powers, such as calculating \(1^{m}+2^{m}+\dots +n^{m}\), and they also arise in series expansions for functions like the tangent. A notable pattern is that all Bernoulli numbers with an odd index are zero, except for the first one (\(B_{1}\)), while the even-indexed numbers (\(B_{2},B_{4},B_{6},\dots \)) alternate in sign.Â
